sub_topic: Calculation of latent heat of fusion of a substance
message_1: What is the amount of energy required to melt 200g of ice at 0℃ and convert it to liquid water at 0℃, given the latent heat of fusion of water is 334 J/g?
message_2:
To calculate the amount of energy required to melt 200g of ice at 0℃ and convert it to liquid water at 0℃, we can use the formula:

Energy (Q) = mass (m) × latent heat of fusion (L)

Given the mass (m) = 200g and the latent heat of fusion (L) = 334 J/g, we can plug these values into the formula:

Q = 200g × 334 J/g

Q = 66800 J

So, the amount of energy required to melt 200g of ice at 0℃ and convert it to liquid water at 0℃ is 66,800 Joules.
